annotation.TEXT: Several tries later...
There we go. Now get him to enter the yellow shell, and while he's doing that, fry the ice block to the right.

Just like that. Now, quickly take the shell up to the upper ledge, burn open the ice blocks with your flower (but be careful not to burn the shell!), and then use the shell to hit the ON/OFF block once. Then, you can destroy the shell if you want. (If you have a cape, the shell is disposable as soon as you stomp the koopa, since you can just cape spin the ON/OFF block.)
Nuts. Blew it at 8000. Now for this next part, I guess I gotta create a hole for those Bowser statues to jump into.
Once he goes disco, just go to the right and get him to break the green blocks and hit the ON/OFF switch so you can enter the pipe!
Obligatory dive bomb FTW!
And that's it for that room. It's definitely tricky, but it's also the fastest room by far (unless there's a way to really break the puzzle room).
Uh, oh! Silver munchers! ...And bloopers? Were these bloopers found anywhere else in this hack? I don't remember...
Huh. If the red buzzy is a spiny, you might potentially get stuck if you only take out the other two buzzies and don't have any power ups to attack the red one with.
Place the springboard over here where it belongs, and toss the key at the ON/OFF block (can be done in either order).
Now, let's restart the level and see where I end up this time...
Hello, and welcome back to Super SIG World 21! I'm not quite done with this game yet!
Oh, are we done already? Not quite. That screen transition is probably just so I can fight enemies from another sprite tileset, such as these moles.
Zeldara109 did inform me of this intended solution, but I had already figured it out by the time I read that comment.
Whoa, this place is hazardous!
Can I get a 1-up combo here?
Once he's climbed in, stomp him one more time (but keep him on this ledge), then let him reenter the shell again to become a disco shell.
Saw that one coming.
Okay, now take the P-switch to the level below the reset door, and hit it there.
May as well TAS the bonus game while I'm at it...
Interesting. It counts as cleared even though I didn't get rid of the shell yet.

Well, as it turns out, there are multiple different rooms you can end up in here, and I guess which one you get is chosen in some random-like way. (LadySuburu mentioned this, but I had already discovered this myself when I read that comment.)
Finally, I got to kill something with a dive bomb quake!
Once the P-switch ends, get the koopa to walk to the right across the bridge you've created.
Aha! There is another room that I can randomly end up in!
Are we done now?
Too bad the shell doesn't work on them...
Now, I got a vote earlier to fly through 3-1 so that you guys can all stop voting for it. Well, here goes...
Yep, I figured I wouldn't fall if I ducked there!
To be continued...
Get the flower (if needed), and toss all the items up through the rope. (Be careful not to accidentally enter the reset door while doing this.)
Okay, that was cool!
Wait for him to hop his way over to the right onto safe ground, then stomp on him twice, but be careful not to let him fall back onto the silver munchers on the left!
Oh, man. This looks tough, but I think there's a way to make it a little easier...
There we... D'oh! How dare you jump over my quake!
Looks like it involves some tricky platforming...
I came, I slid on saws, I conquered. (How did Mario's butt or at least pants not get ripped apart?)
Are we done yet?
I want to show off the "intended" solution to that puzzle in King Koopa's castle, seeing as how I broke part of it last time.
Oh, man. If he had gone disco on me there, that would've been a problem! (Still, I could've tried cape sliding into the last sparky if that happened.)
Yep, we're good. Now what's gonna be up ahead?
Oh, and over here, there's no need to get this koopa to go disco. You can just kick the shell and follow it to the left and that'll work just fine.
And that's it for this puzzle. Now, I wonder if there are any other rooms I could end up in...
What the...? That mushroom stole my flower! And, more importantly, this isn't the puzzle room! What's going on here?
Nope, and this one looks tricky. Better not screw up with that koopa!
Gotta slide-kill this guy! Cape sliding will do!
Nuts. I wanted to dive bomb the ground to kill these guys.
Now, quite obviously, that was a TAS. If there are any other levels in Super SIG World 21 you want me to TAS, vote now!
Ah, man. If I had waited a bit on that dive bomb, I could've preemptively taken out that Chuck!
I'm guessing it counts as a win if the enemy goes offscreen on its own.
Yep, now we're done. I guess if you like battling and hate puzzles, that's a preferred room for you!
Okay, I got the puzzle room this time, so I guess I'll show off the "intended" solution now.
Be quick at this point. Either collect the coins that were blocks blocking the koopa, or at least make sure the koopa has spawned and is walking around on the floor below.
Now, hit every ? block (except the one in the pit, of course), but don't collect the floating coins they leave behind. Then jump up through the rope.
And now for Roto-Disc dodging!
Now, I tried several more times, and couldn't get any other rooms to appear, so I think that's all of them. However, if there actually is another room that I didn't visit, let me know!
Oh, I'd better be careful here if I don't want to take a lava bath! (And, not having a cape now will make things even trickier!)
They were kind enough to include an ice block in case you didn't have a cape for that guy. Maybe I can use the ice block over here?
I guess the way this room works is that you have defeat all of the current enemies on the screen, and then it'll scroll forward a bit, to the next fight. That's pretty neat.
I guess I had to wait a second there for the football to go out of bounds.
Meanwhile, the koopa below will have entered another shell and become a high jumping parakoopa. Hopefully, you'll have opened the gate for him in time!
Some parts of this would probably be easier to do small.
Oh, and if you accidentally lose the ice block before freeing them all, you can use the P-switch or key to free the rest (so free the P-switch or key first).
12-life combo! (15 if you count the 3-up from getting 50 stars!)
When he nears the edge, stomp him so that he flies off the edge to the right and lands on the silver munchers. (If he goes left, just wait until he reenters his shell and try again.)
Huh. So fence koopas can't be killed by a thrown shell...
Ow. Well, that jump didn't go perfectly, but it was a mighty tricky jump anyway.
Go through that pipe and free all of these items (the flower is optional if you already have one).
Well, the ice block did have a use, I guess.
So, let's just fly over here and enter this door...

At least you can jump on them to kill them, just like in the Lost Levels. (Actually, if they ever appeared out of water in the original SMB, you could stomp them there too, but that won't happen without modifying the game in some way.)
NOTICE: I've removed the content ID matched audio from this point to about 9:12.
